name: Saltmarsh Flats
role_in_state: Primary salt and reagent production hub
culture_adjustments: Coastal Tongues variant rich in tidal terminology
practical hospitality reorganized around tide schedules
tighter clan-harbor kinship; communal salt-work apprenticeships
ritual practice focused on tide-rites and harvest taboos
weaker guild formalism; more itinerant labor pooling
constraints: unstable peat/soft ground prevents large shipyards
seasonal access cut by tides and storms
ritual reagent supply dependent on long-distance imports
notes: state relies on flats' salt for curing and long-distance trade
marsh flats are sacred; ritual calendars regulate harvest timing
navigation through flats requires local pilots and augury services
